Edging: 1st rnd: (RS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *(1 dc. Ch 3. Sl st into 3rd ch from hook – picot made. 1 dc) in center dc of next 3 dc group. 1 sc in sp between 3 dc groups. Rep from * 3 times. (1 dc. Picot. 1 dc) in center dc of last 3 dc group. 1 sc in same sp as next sl st. 1 sc in each st around Upper. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
FLOWER (make 2)
With A, ch 4. 1st rnd: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. Ch 3. (Sl st. Ch 3. 1 dc. Ch 3) 4 times in same sp. Sl st in same sp. Fasten off. Sew to Top of Slipper as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 0373 Petal Pink A, 0774 Lt Raspberry B, 0341 Light Grey C, 0311 White D, 0312 Black E.
Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6].
Yarn needle, stitch marker, elastic cord (optional).
abbreviations: A, B, C, D and E = Color A, B, C, D and E
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: One slipper measures 5½ (6½, 7½)” long. Directions are for Child’s Size Small. Changes for Child’s Sizes Medium and Large are in parentheses.
gauge: 16 sts = 4”; 10 rounds = 2¼” in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PIG SLIPPER (make 2)
Sole
Sole is worked, from the center of the foot outwards, in joined rounds. Do not turn at the ends of rounds.
With A, ch 15 (19, 23).
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 8 (10, 12) ch, hdc in next ch, dc in next 3 (5, 7) ch, 5 dc in last ch for toe; working across opposite side of foundation, dc in next 3 (5, 7) ch, hdc in next ch, sc in next 8 (10, 12) ch, 2 sc in last ch; join with slip st in first sc—33 (41, 49) sts.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 13 (17, 21) sts, 2 sc in next st, 3 sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 13 (17, 21) sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in last st; join with slip st in first sc—39 (47, 55) sts.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 16 (20, 24) sts, 2 sc in next st, 3 sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 16 (20, 24) sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in last st; join with slip st in first sc—45 (53, 61) sts.
Round 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 18 (22, 26) sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, 3 sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 18 (22, 26) sts, 2 sc in last st; join with slip st in first sc—53 (61, 69) sts. Fasten off.
Upper
Upper is worked, from the ankle opening downwards, in joined rounds. Turn at the end of each round.
With A, ch 29 (37, 45); taking care not to twist ch, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Children will love wearing their little pig or mouse slippers! They are quick to crochet and are a memorable gift idea.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, sc in first 13 (17, 21) ch, 2 dc in next ch, 3 dc in next ch, 2 dc in next ch, sc in next 13 (17, 21) ch; join with slip st in first sc, turn—33 (41, 49) sts.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st around to last st, 2 sc in last st; join with slip st in first sc, turn—35 (43, 51) sts.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first 16 (20, 24) sts, 2 dc in next st, 3 dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, sc in next 16 (20, 24) sts; join with slip st in first sc, turn—39 (47, 55) sts.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc, turn.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first 17 (21, 25) sts, 2 dc in each of next 2 sts, 3 dc in next st, 2 dc in each of next 2 sts, sc in next 17 (21, 25) sts; join with slip st in first sc, turn—45 (53, 61) sts.
Round 6: Repeat Round 2—47 (55, 63) sts.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in first 21 (25, 29) sts, 2 dc in each of next 2 sts, 3 dc in next st, 2 dc in each of next 2 sts, sc in next 21 (25, 29) sts; join with slip st in first sc—53 (61, 69) sts.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc, turn. Do not fasten off.
Join Upper to Sole: Hold Wrong Sides of sole and upper together, matching sts. Working through both thicknesses, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Elastic Edging (optional): With Right Side facing, place a length of elastic cord over top edge of ankle opening, leaving ends of elastic cord extending over back of heel. Join A with sc in top edge at back of heel, working over the elastic cord, sc evenly spaced around ankle opening; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Pull gently on ends of elastic cord and tie ends together securely.
Face
With A, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; do not join—8 sc. Place marker for beginning of round, move marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—16 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times—24 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 8 times—32 sc. 
First Ear: Ch 2, [yarn over, insert hook in next st, yarn over and draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] 3 times (4 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through 3 loops on hook, yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook (first ear made). Fasten off.
Second Ear: With Right Side facing, skip next 3 sc following first ear, join A with slip st in next sc, work same first ear. Fasten off.
Snout: With A, ch 4, 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, 4 sc in last ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next ch, 2 sc in next ch; join with slip st in first sc—10 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew snout to center of face. With E, embroider French Knot eyes above snout, and straight stitch nostrils on snout. With B, embroider straight stitch mouth below snout. Sew face to top of slipper. Weave in ends.
MOUSE SLIPPER (make 2)
With C, make sole and upper, join sole to upper and add elastic edging (optional) same as for pig slipper.
Face
With C, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Work Rounds 1–4 of face for pig.
First Ear: Drop C from hook, but do not fasten off, join A with slip st in next sc, ch 3, 6 dc in same sc. Fasten off A. 
Place dropped loop of C back on hook, working across A-colored sts, 2 sc in top of beginning ch-3, 2 sc in each of next 6 dc, slip st in next 5 sc of face. Do not fasten off.
Second Ear: Work same as first ear, omitting last 5 slip sts. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With E, embroider satin stitch nose on center of face, French Knot eyes above nose, and straight stitch mouth below nose. With D, embroider straight stitch whiskers on both sides of nose. Sew face to top of slipper. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 319 Cherry Red A, 311 White B, 706 Perfect Pink C and 313 Aran
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Black and Red 6-strand embroidery flosses
yarn needle
stitch marker
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Slippers measure 5½ (6½, 7½)" [14 (16.5, 19) cm] long.
gauge: 16 sc = 4" [10 cm]; 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SLIPPER (make 2)
Sole
With A, ch 15 (19, 23).
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 8 (10, 12) ch, hdc in next ch, dc in next 3 (5, 7) ch, 5 dc in last ch for toe, turn to work across opposite side of foundation, dc in next 3 (5, 7) ch, hdc in next ch, sc in next 8 (10, 12) ch, 2 sc in last ch; join with slip st in first sc – 33 (41, 49) sts. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 13 (17, 21) sts, 2 sc in next st, 3 sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 13 (17, 21) sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in last st; join with slip st in first sc – 39 (47, 55) sts.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 16 (20, 24) sts, 2 sc in next st, 3 sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 16 (20, 24) sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in last st; join with slip st in first sc – 45 (53, 61) sts.
Round 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 18 (22, 26) sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, 3 sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 18 (22, 26) sts, 2 sc in last st; join with slip st in first sc – 53 (61, 69) sts. Fasten off.
Upper
Upper is worked from the ankle opening downwards in joined rounds. Turn at the end of each round.
With B, ch 29 (37, 45); taking care not to twist ch, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, sc in first 13 (17, 21) ch, 2 dc in next ch, 3 dc in next ch, 2 dc in next ch, sc in next 13 (17, 21) ch; join with slip st in first sc, turn – 33 (41, 49) sts.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st around to last st, 2 sc in last st; join with slip st in first sc, turn – 35 (43, 51) sts.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first 16 (20, 24) sts, 2 dc in next st, 3 dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, sc in next 16 (20, 24) sts; join with slip st in first sc, turn – 39 (47, 55) sts.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc, turn.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first 17 (21, 25) sts, 2 dc in each of next 2 sts, 3 dc in next st, 2 dc in each of next 2 sts, sc in next 17 (21, 25) sts; join with slip st in first sc, turn – 45 (53, 61) sts.
Round 6: Repeat Round 2 – 47 (55, 63) sts.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in first 21 (25, 29) sts, 2 dc in each of next 2 sts, 3 dc in next st, 2 dc in each of next 2 sts, sc in next 21 (25, 29) sts; join with slip st in first sc – 53 (61, 69) sts.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc, turn. Do not fasten off.
Join Upper to Sole: Hold Wrong Sides of Sole and Upper together, matching sts. Working through both thicknesses, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
SANTA HAT
Beginning at bottom edge of hat, with A, ch 15.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each remaining ch across – 14 sc.
Rows 2-5: Ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, sc2tog over next 2 sc, sc to last 3 sc, sc2tog over next 2 sc, sc in last sc – 6 sc remain on last row worked.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, [sc2tog over next 2 sc] twice, sc in last sc – 4 sc. 
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, [sc2tog over next 2 sc] twice – 2 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog over next 2 sc. Fasten off.
FACE
Beginning at top of face, with D, ch 13.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each remaining ch across – 12 sc.
Rows 2-4: Ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, sc2tog over next 2 sc, sc to last 3 sc, sc2tog over next 2 sc, sc in last sc – 6 sc remain on last row worked. Change to B at end of Row 4.
Begin Beard
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog over first 2 sc, sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog over last 2 sc. Fasten off.
Center Face at bottom of Hat and sew in place. 
HAT BAND
With B, ch 15.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across. Fasten off, leaving a long end of yarn to sew in place at bottom of Hat.
NOSE
With C, ch 2, work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join to first sc with slip st. Fasten off, leaving long end of yarn. Gather 6 sts together slightly and sew in place. 
FINISHING
With black embroidery floss, embroider French knot eyes. With red, embroider couched stitch mouth on Face.
Join B at top of Hat with a slip st, ch 1, 3 sc in top of Hat, sc around entire Hat and Head; join with a slip st to first sc, leaving a long end of yarn for sewing in place on front of slipper.
Pompom 
With B, ch 4, work 11 dc in 4th ch from hook; join to top of beginning ch with slip st. Fasten off, leaving long end of yarn. Gather all sts together and pull tightly to shape pompom. Sew in place.
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart ® Hygge™ (5 oz/141 g; 132 yds/121 m) Contrast A Powder (8724) 1 ball
Red Heart® Hygge Fur™ (7 oz/200 g; 260 yds/238 m) Contrast B Cotton Tail (0108) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. H/8 (5 mm) and U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: To fit woman’s shoe sizes 5/6 (7/8-9/10).
gauge: Red Heart ® Hygge™: 11 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook. Red Heart® Hygge Fur™: 11 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook and 2 strands held tog.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes, the instructions will be written thus (). Instructions for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. 
Notes: Rnds are joined with sl st to first hdc or sc of rnd. Ch 2 at beg of row/rnd does not count as st.
Slipper (make 2 alike)
With A and larger hook, ch 3.
1st rnd: 8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 16 hdc,
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
Rep 6th rnd until work measures 4 (4½-5)" [10 (11.5-12.5) cm].
Begin working in rows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in next hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 18 hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 22 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in next hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 3 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in last st. Turn. 20 hdc.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 8 (9-10)" [20.5 (23-25.5) cm].
Begin heel shaping:
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 18 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 16 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. (Sc2tog) twice.1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 14 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 12 sts.
Fasten off.
With RS facing, fold along center of final row and match rem 12 sts as pairs of 6 sts. Sew back seam.
Trim
With smaller hook and 2 strands of B held tog, join with sl st to left of back seam.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 28 (30-32) sc evenly around top of Slipper. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 12 (13-14) sts. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 26 (28-30) sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 11 (12-13) sts. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 24 (26-28) sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Fasten off.
Pompoms (make 2)
Wind B around 4 fingers approx 100 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to smooth round shape. Attach pompoms to Slippers as shown in photo.

materials: Phentex® Slipper and Craft Yarn (3 oz/85 g; 164 yds/150 m)
Contrast A Denim Heather (07115) 2 2 2 balls
Contrast B Ultra Navy (00857) 1 1 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcbp made
measurements: To fit Man’s shoe size Medium 7/8, Large 9/10, Extra-Large 11/11½
gauge: 9 sc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Note: Slippers are worked with 2 strands of yarn tog throughout.
Sole: With 2 strands of B, ch 16 (18-20).
1st rnd: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each of next 11 (13-15) ch. 5 dc in last ch. Working into rem loop on opposite side of ch, 1 dc in each of next 11 (13-15) ch. 3 dc in last ch. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 32 (36-40) dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of first 2 dc. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 (10-12) dc. 2 dc in each of next 5 dc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 (10-12) dc. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 2 sc in each of last 3 dc. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 (46-50) sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 2 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 2 hdc in each of next 3 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 (10-12) sts. 1 dc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 dc in each of next 10 dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 (10-12) hdc. 2 hdc in each of last 6 sc. Join A with sl st to top of ch 2. Break B.
Cont as follows:
Sides: 1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 dcbp in each st around. Join with sl st to first st. 62 (66-70) sts.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off at end of 3rd rnd.
Upper: With 2 strands of A, ch 6.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 5 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows twice more. 11 sc at end of last row.
Next 2 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). (Yoh and draw up a loop in next sc. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – dc2tog made. 1 dc in each sc to last 3 sc. Dc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
Join Upper to Sides: Pin Upper to Sides. Join 2 strands of A with sl st at left corner of Upper. Working through both thicknesses, sl st in each hdc of Sides to opposite corner of Upper. Working across rem sts of Sides, 1 sc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.

materials: Lily Sugar’n Cream (70.9 g/2.5 oz)
Main Color (MC): (Yellow) 1 ball
Contrast A: (White) 1 ball
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Pair of rubber flip-flops.
Glue.
measurements: Daisy Motif = 3 ins [7.5 cm] round.
instructions:
Daisy Motif: Make 2 Daisy Motifs (one for each flip-flop).
With MC, ch 5. Join in rnd.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in rnd. Join A with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 7. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 petals.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in missed sc in last rnd. *Ch 7. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in next missed sc in last rnd. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 petals.
Note: 5 petals from 2nd rnd should alternate with 5 petals from 3rd rnd.
Fasten off.
Glue 1 Daisy to each flip-flop as shown in picture.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Baby™ (5 oz/140 g; 362 yds/331 m)
Main Color (MC) Little Mouse (30010) 1 ball
Contrast A Aqua (30201) 1 ball
Contrast B Soft Red (30424) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size: To fit baby 3-6 months.
instructions:
Foot: With MC, ch 9.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sc. (2 hdc in next sc) twice. 1 hdc in next sc. (2 hdc in next sc) twice. 1 hdc in each of next 6 sc. 3 hdc in last sc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 6 hdc. (2 hdc in next hdc) 3 times. 3 dc in next hdc (mark center st for toe). (2 hdc in next hdc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 hdc. 3 sc in next hdc. 1 sc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first sc. 34 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
5th rnd: (WS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
6th rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Move toe st marker to correct position in last rnd.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc until 5 sc before toe st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc (toe st). Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc until 4 sts before toe st. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in next sc (toe st). (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 26 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc until 4 sts before toe st. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in next sc (toe st). (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 22 sts.
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Cuff: 1st row: Join yarn with sl st to back loop only of sc after toe st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 20 sc. Turn. Leave toe st unworked. (21 sc).
2nd row: (WS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 24 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Cuff measures 1½" [4 cm]. Fasten off.
Pompoms (make 2 each with A and B)
Wind yarn around 3 fingers approx 50 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape, approx ¾" [2 cm] diameter. Sew in position securely onto Bootie as shown in photo.

materials: Red Heart® Hygge™ (5 oz/141 g; 132 yds/121 m)
Main Contrast (MC) Rust (8319) 238 yds/218m, 248 yds/227 m, 258 yds/234 m
Contrast A Powder (8724) 40 yds/38m, 45 yds/41.5m, 47 yds/43 m
Red Heart® Hygge Fur™ (7 oz/200 g; 260 yds/238 m) Contrast B Cotton Tail (0108) 1 ball 1 ball 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge. Stitch marker.
abbreviations: Dc2(3)tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and pull through 2 loops on hook) 2(3) times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: To fit woman’s shoe size: 5/6 (7/8-9/10). Finished foot length: 8½ (9¼-10)" [21.5 (23.5-25.5) cm]
gauge: 11 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm] with Red Heart® Hygge™.
instructions:
Sole: With MC, ch 4 (5-6).
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 3 (4-5) sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 (6-7) sc.
Rep 2nd row once more. 7 (8-9) sc.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 4¼ (4½-5)" [11 (11.5-12.5) cm].

Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 9 (10-11) sc.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 7½ (8¼-9)" [19 (21-23) cm].
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. 7 (8-9) sc.
Rep last row until 3 (4-5) sc rem. Fasten off.

Upper: Join A with sl st to center back heel of Sole. 
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Work 55 (63-71) sc evenly around edge of Sole. Join. Turn.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Break A. Join MC. Turn.
3rd rnd: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Turn.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 20 (22-26) sc. (Dc2tog) 3 (4-4) times. Dc3tog. (Dc2tog) 3 (4-4) times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. Turn. 47 (53-61) sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 16 (17-21) sc. (Dc2tog) 3 (4-4) times. Dc3tog. (Dc2tog) 3 (4-4) times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. Turn. 39 (43-51) sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 12 (14-16) sc. (Dc2tog) 3 (3-4) times. Dc3tog. (Dc2tog) 3 (3-4) times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. Turn. 31 (35-41) sts.

Size 9/10 only: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 19 sts. Dc3tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. Turn. 39 sts.
All sizes: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Turn.

Leg: Rep last rnd until Leg measures 3 (3½-4)" [7.5 (9-10) cm], ending on a WS rnd.
Next rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. Turn. 33 (37-41) sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Turn.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. Turn. 35 (39-43) sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Turn.
Rep last rnd until Leg measures 8 (8½-9)" [20.5 (21.5-23) cm], ending on a RS rnd. Fasten off.

Cuff: With B, ch 35 (39-43). Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. Place marker on first st. 35 (39-43) sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep 2nd rnd until Cuff measures 3 (3½-3½)" [7.5 (9-9) cm]. Break B. Join A.
Next rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.

Slip Cuff over top of Leg of Slipper with WS of Cuff facing RS of Leg. Working through both thicknesses, join A with sl st to any st of last rnd.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Pompoms: Wind A around 3 fingers approx 50 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center with length of yarn approx. 12" [30.5 cm] long. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Attach Pompoms to Slippers as shown in picture.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Petal Pink (0373) 2 balls
Contrast B Black (0312) 2 balls
Sizes U.S. G/6 [4 mm] crochet hook or sizes needed to obtain gauge.
Fiberfill stuffing.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Directions are for an adult medium 8-9" [20.5-23 cm] foot.
instructions:
SLIPPERS
Snout (Make 2)
1st rnd: With A ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with a slip st in first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 5 times. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next 2 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next 2 sc) 5 times. Join. 24 sc. Fasten off; this is the lower edge of the Snout.
Outer Slipper (Make 2)
With RS facing attach A in back loop of a sc at the upper edge of Snout.
1st row (RS): Ch 1. 1 sc in back loop of same sc as joining. 1 sc in back loop of each sc around; do not join. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in both loops of each sc across. Turn.
3rd row: Repeat Row 2.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first 2 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next 5 sc) 3 times. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last 3 sc. Turn. 28 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first 3 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next 6 sc) 3 times. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last 3 sc. Turn. 32 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first 3 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next 7 sc) 3 times. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last 4 sc. Turn. 36 sc.
**Continue in sc increasing 4 sts evenly spaced until there are 64 sts. Then work even in sc until 10½" [26.5 cm] from beginning, ending on a WS row.
Shape Heel
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first 4 sc; *(draw up a loop in next st) twice, yoh and through all 3 loops on hook - sc2tog made. 1 sc in next 4 sc. Rep from * across. Turn. 54 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first 4 sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next 3 sc) 10 times. Turn. 44 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first 4 sts. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next 2 sts) 10 times. Turn. 34 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first 4 sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) 10 times. Turn. 24 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first 4 sc. (Sc2tog) 10 times. Turn. 14 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 7 times. Turn. 7 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 4 sts. Fasten off. **
Slipper Lining (Make 2)
Toe
With A, ch 5.
1st row (RS): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc across. Turn. 8 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 12 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first 2 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next 2 sc) 3 times. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 16 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first 3 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next 3 sc) 3 times. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 20 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first 4 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next 4 sc) 3 times. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 24 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first 5 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next 5 sc) 3 times. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 28 sc.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first 6 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next 6 sc) 3 times. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 32 sc.
Work even in sc until 8½" [21.5 cm] from beginning, ending on a WS row.
Shape Heel
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first 2 sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next 3 sc) 6 times. Turn. 26 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first 2 sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next 2 sc) 6 times. Turn. 20 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first 2 sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) 6 times. Turn. 14 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 7 times. Turn. 7 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 4 sc. Fasten off.
Ears (Make 4)
With A ch 7.
1st row (RS): 2 Sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next 4 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc. Fasten off.
Tail (Make 2)
With A ch 10. 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 2 sc in each ch across. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew center front seam of outer slipper from snout to foot opening for 5" [12.5 cm]. Sew center back seam of outer slipper from heel to foot opening for 1½" [4 cm]. Sew center front seam of lining slipper from toe to foot opening for 2½" [6 cm]. Sew center back seam of lining slipper from heel to foot opening for 1½" [4 cm]. Join foot opening of lining to foot opening of slipper by 1 round sc along edge through both thicknesses, stuffing slipper firmly. Sew on ears as shown. Attach tail at back. With B Embroider eyes, Straight Stitch eyelashes and nostrils.

materials: Phentex Craft Yarn (85 g/3 oz; 150 m/164 yds)
Main Color (MC) Hot Blue (07742): 1-2 ball(s) depending on size
Contrast A Matador (00570): 1 ball
Contrast B White (00101): 1 ball
Contrast C Black (00106): 1 ball
Contrast D Blue Belle (00842): 1 ball
Crochet hooks: Sizes 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) and 6 mm (U.S. J or 10) or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: To fit kid’s/adult’s shoe sizes: Extra-Small: 3/4, Small: 5/6, Medium: 7/8
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Note: Sole is crocheted with 2 strands tog. Upper is crocheted with one strand.
Sole 
Beg at heel, with 2 strands of MC and larger hook, ch 4.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc. Turn.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sc at end of 3rd row.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 6½ (7-7½)" [16.5 (18-19) cm], ending with a WS row.
Shape toe: 1st row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sts.
Rep last row once more. 3 sts. Fasten off.
Upper 
First Side: **Beg at heel end, with single strand of MC and smaller hook, ch 10 (10-11).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 (9-10) sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 3½ (3½-4)" [9 (9-10) cm], ending with a WS row.**
Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows once more. 13 (13-14) sc. Fasten off.
Second Side: Work from ** to ** as given for First Side.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows once more. 13 (13-14) sc. Do not fasten off.
Join Sides: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of 13 (13-14) sc from Second Side. 1 sc in each of 13 (13-14) sc from First Side. Turn. 26 (26-28) sc. Place marker on last st.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marker measures 1 (1½-2)" [2.5 (4-5) cm], ending with a WS row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 (3-4) sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * twice more. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 (3-4) sc. Turn. 22 (22-24) sc.
Next 7 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 (2-3) sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * twice more. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 3 (3-4) sc. Turn. 18 (18-20) sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 (2-3) sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 sc in each of last 0 (0-1) sc. Turn. 14 (14-16) sc.
Next row: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 7 (7-8) sc.
Next row: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * to last 1 (1-0) st. 1 (1-0) sc in last st. 4 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.
FINISHING
Sew center back heel seam of Upper. Pin Upper to Sole.
Join Upper and Sole: 1st rnd: With RS facing and smaller hook, join MC with sl st at heel seam. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 rnd of sc evenly around outer edge. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Edging: With RS facing and smaller hook, join MC with sl st at heel seam and work 1 rnd of sc around cuff edge. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Mouth (make 2)
With A and smaller hook, ch 14.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 dc in next sc. 3 tr in next sc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in next sc. Sl st in each of next 2 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 tr in each of next 7 sc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Sl st in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Eyes (make 6)
With C and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join B with sl st to first first sc. Break C.
2nd rnd: With C, ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join D with sl st to first sc. Break B. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: With D, ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. Fasten off.
Ears (make 4)
With MC and 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) hook, ch 8. Join with sl st to form ring.
1st to 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th and 6th rnds: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc at end of 6th rnd. Fasten off.
Sew Mouth, Eyes and Ears to Slipper as shown in picture. With C, embroider lips and eyelashes using straight st.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter Cotton (50 g/1.75 oz) Main Color (MC):(Yellow) 1 ball

measurements: Daisy Motif = 3 ins [7.5 cm] round.
instructions:
Daisy Motif: Make 2 Daisy Motifs (one for each flip-flop).
With MC, ch 5. Join in rnd.
1st rnd:Ch 1. 10 sc in rnd. Join A with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd:With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 7. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 petals.
3rd rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in missed sc in last rnd. *Ch 7. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in next missed sc in last rnd. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 petals.
Note: 5 petals from 2nd rnd should alternate with 5 petals from 3rd rnd.
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein 319 Cherry Red.
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Designed for size Small. Changes for Medium and Large are in parentheses.
gauge: 10 dc = 4”; and 6 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
SLIPPERS (make 2)
First Side and Sole
Row 1: Ch 23 (25, 27) dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—21 (23, 25) sts.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc across, turn—21 (23, 25) sts.
Rows 3-8: Rep Row 2.
instep
Row 9-12: Ch 3, dc in next 8 (10, 12) sts, turn— 9 (11, 13) sts.
Row 13: Ch 3, dc across in each dc across, ch 14, turn.
Second Side and Sole
Row 14: Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each st across, turn—21  (23, 25) sts.
Row 15-21: Repeat Row 2. Fasten off at the end of Row 21.
Finishing
Place instep on top of foot and wrap sides around foot, overlapping sole layers. Pin layers together. Sew each side of sole to sides of slipper. Gather stitches at toe. Sew heal seam. With RS facing, join yarn at top of heal seam, sc in each st around opening, working 2 sc into the ends of the rows across instep, join with slip st in to first sc. 
Make loop: Ch 10, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Fasten off. Sew end of loop to top of heel seam and weave in ends.
Flower (make 2)
Ch 18, [dc, ch 3, slip st, (ch 3, dc, ch 3, slip st) 2 times] in 4th ch from hook, [slip st, ch 3, dc, ch 3, slip st] in each remaining ch—17 petals.
Starting with the first 3 petals, spiral the petals around in 3 layers. Tack the layers together and sew to instep of slipper.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Stripes™ (5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m)

measurements: To fit Adult shoe size: 5/6 ( 7/8–9/10). Finished Foot length S (5/6) 9" [ 23 cm], M (7/8) 9½" [ 24 cm], L (9/10) 10½" [ 26.5 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for size S. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written S (M-L). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.
Notes: • Slippers are based on 1 Hexagon with extra rows along side and top edges. • Toe edge has decreases for shaping. • Final piece is folded and seamed along side, bottom and toe edges. • Hexagon shape will become wavy as you progress and will not lay flat as it begins to grow. Do not worry if your piece does not lay flat before folding! Trust the process! HEXAGON See Diagram on page 3. Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc at beg of this and subsequent rnds). 2 dc in ring. (Ch 2. 3 dc) 5 times in ring. Join with hdc to top of ch 3 for corner ch-2. 6 groups of 3 dc and 6 ch-2 sps. 2nd rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc around post of joining hdc. *Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. 3 dc around post of joining hdc (first ch-2 sp). Join with hdc to top of ch 3 for corner ch-2.
Beg working in rows:
1st row: Ch 3. 2 dc around post of joining hdc. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next corner ch-2 sp. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked (last side of Hexagon).
2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch-1 sp). *(Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) to last 3 dc before next corner ch-2 sp. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) to last 3 dc. Ch 1. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 2 dc in next ch-1 sp. *(Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) to last 3 dc before next corner ch-2 sp. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) to last 3 dc. 2 dc in 4th ch of turning ch-4. 1 dc in 3rd ch of turning ch-4. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 1 (2-3) time(s) more.
Shape toe: 1st row: (WS). Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch-1 sp). *(Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) to last 3 dc before next corner ch-2 sp. Skip next 3 dc.* (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * to * once more. (3 dc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in next corner ch-2 sp. (Skip next dc. 1 hdc in next dc. Skip next dc. 1 hdc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) to last 3-dc group before next corner ch-2 sp. Skip next dc. 1 hdc in next dc. Skip next dc. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * to * once more. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) to last 3 dc. Ch 1. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 3. 2 dc in next ch-1 sp. *(Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) to last 3 dc before next corner ch-2 sp. Skip next 3 dc.* (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * to * once more. (3 dc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in next corner ch-2 sp. (Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc) to next corner ch-2 sp. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * to * once more. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) to last 3 dc. 2 dc in 4th ch of turning ch-4. 1 dc in 3rd ch of turning ch-4. Do not turn.
Top edging: 1st row: (RS). Working across side edge of Slipper: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch-1). *3 dc around post of dc next row below. Skip post of dc of next row below (first dc of 3-dc group). Rep from * to next corner ch-2 sp of 2nd rnd. 3 dc in corner ch-2 sp. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. 3 dc in next corner ch-2 sp. **Skip post of dc of next row (first dc of 3-dc group). 3 dc around post of dc of next row. Rep from ** to last row. 1 dc in corner dc of last row. Do not break yarn. Fold Slipper with sides, bottom and toe edges aligned (see photo). Using Flat Sl St seam, join sides and bottom edge. Break yarn leaving a long end. Thread yarn end through rem sts pull tightly to close toe end and fasten securely. Seaming with Flat Sl St: (RS). Work through back loops only and keep working yarn to WS of work to create a flat sl st chain detail on RS of work (see diagram).

materials: Bernat® Softee Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m) COLORS
Contrast A Hot Pink (28416) or Gray Ragg (28047)
Optional Pompom - Contrast B Brass (28807)
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume crochet hook
Susan Bates® yarn needle
Tape measure
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit adult’s shoe size: 5/6 (7/8-9/10). Finished foot length: 9 (9½-10½)" [23 (24-26.5) cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for 5/6 size. If changes are necessary, the instructions will be written 5/6 (7/8 - 9/10). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

USING THIS GUIDE
Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools.

NOTES
• Join each round (rnd) with slip stitch (sl st) to first stitch (st).
• Chain (ch) 2 at beginning (beg) of rnd does not count as half double crochet (hdc).

Make a slip knot and place on hook.
Slip Knot: Make a loop with yarn and fold it on itself to make a pretzel shape. Then pull through to make slip knot.
Chain: Yarn over hook (Yoh) and draw up a loop. 

Beginning (Beg) at toe with A, ch 3. (See Diagram 1 for beginning of Slipper on page 6).

Hdc: Yarn over hook (Yoh) and draw up a loop in 3rd chain (ch) from hook. (3 loops on hook) Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - hdc made.

1st rnd: 10 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with slip stitch (sl st) in first hdc. 10 hdc in rnd. 1st rnd is complete.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Repeat (rep) from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st in first hdc. 15 hdc. 2nd rnd is complete.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st in first hdc. 20 hdc. 3rd rnd is complete.

Sizes 7/8 and 9/10 only: 4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 9 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st in first hdc. 22 hdc. 

All sizes: Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st in first hdc. 20 (22 - 22) hdc. Rep last rnd until piece measures 4 (4½ - 5)" [10 (11.5 - 12.5) cm].

1st row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 12 (14 - 14) hdc. Turn. Leave remaining (rem) sts unworked. 

2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. 12 (14 - 14) hdc. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from beg measures 9¼ (9¾ - 10¼)" [23.5 (25 - 26) cm]. 
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 4 (5 - 5) hdc. [(Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - hdc2tog made] twice. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.

Hdc2tog: [Yarn over hook (Yoh) and draw up a loop in next st] twice. (5 loops on hook.) Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - hdc2tog made.

Join back of foot: Fold work in half, working through both thicknesses, sl st in each st to end of row. Fasten off.

Top edging: With Right Side (RS) facing, join yarn with sl st at center back seam. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around top of Slipper. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Pompom (optional) make 2: Wind B around 4 fingers 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Slipper. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Slipper as shown in photo.

Upper

Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows once more. Fasten off. 13 (13-14) sc. 
Second Side: Work from ** to ** as given for First Side.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows once more. 13 (13-14) sc. Do not fasten off.
Join Sides: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of 13 (13-14) sc from Second Side. 1 sc in each of 13 (13-14) sc from First Side. Turn. 26 (26-28) sc. Place marker on last st.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marker measures 1 (1½-2)" [2.5 (4-5) cm], ending with a WS row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 (3-4) sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * twice more. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 (3-4) sc. Turn. 22 (22-24) sc. 
Next 7 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 (2-3) sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * twice more. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 3 (3-4) sc. Turn. 18 (18-20) sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 (2-3) sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 sc in each of last 0 (0-1) sc. Turn. 14 (14-16) sc. 
Next row: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 7 (7-8) sc.

FINISHING
Sew center back heel seam of Upper. Pin Upper to Sole. 
Join Upper and Sole: 1st rnd: With RS facing and smaller hook, join MC with sl st at heel seam. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 rnd of sc evenly around outer edge. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Edging: With RS facing and smaller hook, join MC with sl st at heel seam and work 1 rnd of sc around cuff edge. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Eyes (make 2) 
With B and smaller hook, ch 2.
***1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join A with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: With A, ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join MC with sl st to first sc. 
3rd rnd: With MC, ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
4th to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.*** 
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Break MC, leaving a long end.
Stuff Eye. Thread yarn through rem sts pull tightly and fasten securely. 
Eyelid (make 2) 
With MC and smaller hook, work from *** to *** as given for Eye. 
Insert Eye into Eyelid. Sew each Eye to top of Slipper as shown in picture. 
teeth (make 2) 
With A and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
3rd to 5th rnds: Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off at end of last rnd. 
Sew at side of front as shown in picture. 
tail (make 2) 
With MC and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc around. Join MC with sl st to first sc. 
4th rnd: With MC, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: With MC, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc around. Join B with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: With B, as 3rd rnd. 
7th and 8th rnds: With MC, as 4th rnd. Fasten off at end of last rnd. 
Sew to back of Slipper. 
Wings (make 2)
With MC and smaller hook, ch 15. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 
2nd to 12th rows: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to last sc. turn. Leave rem sc unworked. Fasten off at end of last row. 
Gather one side of Wing. Sew in position at either side of each Slipper.

SOLE With B, ch 13 (16-19). 1st rnd: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into rem loops across opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Join. 26 (32-38) sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 (13-16) sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 (36-42) sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 (13-16) sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 34 (40-46) sc. 4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 (13-16) sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 38 (44-50) sc. 5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 (13-16) sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 (48-54) sc. Sizes 4 and 6 only: 6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next (13-16) sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. (52-58) sc. All sizes: Do not fasten off. Join A. UPPER 1st rnd: With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Rep last rnd 1 (2-2) time(s) more. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 14 (18-20) sc. [(Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – Dc4tog made. 1 sc in each of next 1 (2-3) sc] twice. Dc4tog. 1 sc in each of next 14 (18-20) sc. Join. 33 (43-49) sts. Next rnd: 1 sc in each of next 8 ( 13-16) sc. (Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – Sc2tog made. 1 sc in next sc) 6 times. 1 sc in each of next 7 ( 12-15) sc. Join. 27 (37-43) sc. Next rnd: Working in both loops, 1 sc in each of next 8 ( 13-16) sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 (13-16) sc. Join. 23 (33-39) sc. Next rnd: 1 sc in each of next 6 (11-11) sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) 4 (4-6) times. 1 sc in each of next 5 (10-10) sc. Join. 19 (29-33) sc. Sizes 4 and 6 only: Next rnd: 1 sc in each of next (10-11) sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) 4 times. 1 sc in each of next (9-10) sc. Join. (25-29) sc. All sizes: Break A. Join B. CUFF 1st rnd: With B, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each st around. Join. Rep last rnd 3 (4-5) times more. Fasten off. FINISHING With 2 strands of B, embroider claws as shown in picture.
